alert.note: Alert for Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 30 at 2:15AM CDT until October 30 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT /NOON MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT /10 AM MDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 22. For the High Wind Warning, northeast winds 30 to 50 mph with gusts up to 75 mph. * WHERE...For the Freeze Warning, Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains in Texas. For the high Wind Warning, Guadalupe Pass. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, until 1 PM CDT /noon MDT/ this afternoon. For the High Wind Warning, until 11 AM CDT /10 AM MDT/ this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
